importantArticles.headline: Truist lowered the firm’s price target on Huntington Bancshares (HBAN) to $17 from $21 and keeps a Buy rating on the shares. The firm increased its 2025 and 2026 EPS forecasts by 7% and 1% to $1.50 and $1.65, respectively, after a stronger than expected Q1 and FY25 guidance. However, the firm reduced its one-year-out target multiple to reflect a higher recession risk, leading to its lower price target Published first on TheFly – the ultimate source for real-time, market-moving breaking financial
importantArticles.title: Huntington Bancshares price target lowered to $17 from $21 at Truist

importantArticles.headline: Truist lowered the firm’s price target on Huntington Bancshares (HBAN) to $17 from $21 and keeps a Buy rating on the shares. The firm increased its 2025 and 2026 EPS forecasts by 7% and 1% to $1.50 and $1.65, respectively, after a stronger than expected Q1 and FY25 guidance. However, the firm reduced its one-year-out target multiple to reflect a higher recession risk, leading to its lower price target Published first on TheFly – the ultimate source for real-time, market-moving breaking financial
importantArticles.title: Huntington Bancshares price target lowered to $17 from $21 at Truist

importantArticles.headline: As the United States market grapples with significant volatility due to persistent tariff concerns and tensions over Federal Reserve leadership, investors are seeking stability amid the turbulence. In such uncertain times, dividend stocks can offer a reliable income stream and potential for long-term growth, making them an attractive option for those looking to navigate these challenging market conditions.
importantArticles.title: Dividend Stocks To Consider In April 2025

importantArticles.headline: Huntington Bancshares Incorporated (Nasdaq: HBAN) reported net income for the 2025 first quarter of $527 million, or $0.34 per common share, a decrease of $3 million from the prior quarter, and an increase of $108 million, or 26%, from the year-ago quarter.

importantArticles.headline: COLUMBUS, Ohio (AP) — Huntington Bancshares Inc. HBAN) on Thursday reported first-quarter net income of $527 million. The Columbus, Ohio-based bank said it had earnings of 34 cents per share.

The common stock cash dividend is payable July 1, 2025, to shareholders of record on June 17, 2025.

importantArticles.headline: Capstone Partners, a leading middle market investment banking firm, released its 2024 Middle Market M&A Valuations Index, reporting that middle market M&A activity in 2024 showed signs of stabilization after facing valuation pressure in 2023. importantArticles.title: Capstone Partners Reports:  Middle Market M&A Valuations Ease, Market Players Retain Confidence in a Turnaround in 2025

importantArticles.headline: Huntington Bancshares (NasdaqGS:HBAN) announced a quarterly cash dividend on its preferred stock, which is a significant corporate event for stakeholders. Despite this, the company's share price declined by 2% over the past week. This movement occurred during a general market downturn, with the market dropping 3.4%, driven by broader economic concerns, including anticipated tariffs and weak manufacturing data. While the overall market faced volatility and pressure on equities, especially with...
